metadata.title: CVE-2017-15101 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A missing patch for a stack-based buffer overflow in findTable() was foundin Red Hat version of liblouis before 2.5.4. An attacker could cause adenial of service condition or potentially even arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15101` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblouis-bin - 2.5.3-2ubuntu1.2
liblouis-data - 2.5.3-2ubuntu1.2
liblouis2 - 2.5.3-2ubuntu1.2
python-louis - 2.5.3-2ubuntu1.2
python3-louis - 2.5.3-2ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: liblouis package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.3-2ubuntu1.2').
